headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: ad_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ad that you want to get Creative Fatigue detection results for.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Query start date (closed interval), in the format of YYYY-MM-DD (advertiser account time zone). You can only specify a date within the last 60 days.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Query end date (open interval), in the format of YYYY-MM-DD (advertiser account time zone). You can only specify a date within the last 60 days.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Default value: 1. Value range: â‰¥ 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size. Default value: 10. Value range: [1, 500].

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: list
fields.description: Information about the Creative Fatigue detection results.

fields.name: adgroup_id
fields.description: ID of the ad group that the ad ( ad_id ) belongs to.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date for which the values of the metrics are retrieved.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Information about data of the metrics on the date ( date ).

fields.name: fatigue_index
fields.description: The "Fatigue Index" is a comprehensive metric that considers day-over-day changes in CPA, cost, the new users reach rate, and other performance metrics. A higher index value indicates a greater degree of fatigue.

fields.name: dnu
fields.description: DNU. The number of daily new users that the ad attracts.

fields.name: dnu_ratio
fields.description: DNU ratio. This metric is calculated by dividing the number of daily new users attracted by the ad on a specific date by the maximum number of daily new users that the ad attracted in the last 60 days.

fields.name: spend
fields.description: Total cost, which is the estimated total amount of money you've spent on the ad, in the default currency for the ad account.

fields.name: cost_per_conversion
fields.description: This metric returns actual value when the ad is within a non-iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign, and returns 0.0 when the ad is within an iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign. You can check whether a campaign is an iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign via the value of campaign_type returned by /campaign/get/ . CPA, which is the average amount of money spent on a conversion from the ad, in the default currency for the ad account. The total count is calculated based on the time each ad impression occurred.

fields.name: skan_cost_per_conversion
fields.description: This metric returns actual value when the ad is within an iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign, and returns 0.0 when the ad is within a non-iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign. You can check whether a campaign is an iOS 14 Dedicated Campaign via the value of campaign_type returned by /campaign/get/ . CPA (SKAN), the average amount of money spent on a conversion from the ad, in the default currency for the ad account. The total count is based on when the events are returned through the SKAdNetwork API. There may be a delay between the actual conversion time and when the conversion is reported.
